entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/3/A. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F25: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/3/A. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19

entry.dcterms:description: 1) party preferences, voting behavior, popularity of politicians, evaluation of Prime Minister candidates, evaluation of parties, knowledge about election programs and promises, influence of election promises 2) political self-categorization, satisfaction with democracy, subjective financial situation, economic expectations, expectations about the government economic policy, evaluation and use of child support system 3) supply with infocommunication tools, mobile phone use, attitudes about internet, computer use, internet use habits, online purchase 4) habits or reading and buying books, habits of visiting the library, number of books at home, reputation of publishing houses 5) reputation and popularity of participants on TV 6) attitudes about car brands 7) habits of taking a holiday
entry.dcterms:subject: income, property and savings
social behaviour and attitudes
society and culture
information society
mass political behavior, attitudes
family life, marriage, relationship
labour and employment
leisure, tourism and sport
mass media
political institutions, public administration
economic conditions and indicators
consumption/consumer behavior
science and technology
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: A, block 4: D (after 2005-03-01: A), block 5: D, block 6: D
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
